channel.title: Making the status page vote feature more 'reward-friendly'?
channel.description:
I had an idea. There are a bunch of people that have links to their servers voting page on this server status page, where in return the voter gets items on the server, or some sort of thing on the forum. The idea is to add an extension to the voting page where someone can have the option link from their website like this: http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?action=up&server=blahblahblah[b]&returnto=voteconfirmpage.php[/b]
And then in a servers page control panel ('edit server' or whatever) it has a password key that it sends to that confirm page, which then adds the vote to a mysql database.
It's hard to explain in words, but if it would ever be taken into consideration I'd be happy to write a rc version

item.title: Making the status page vote feature more 'reward-friendly'?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:28, topic:367024”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=463218.msg3394319#msg3394319 date=1289188642]

I’m still not sure I want to assist servers in giving rewards in exchange for votes. No one has convinced me why this should be done, yet…
[/quote]First off, just think about how many people on this forum that would be able to put it to functional use anyway. Not many. Secondly, those people that could get it to work, wont necessarily need to offer a reward for it, it could be used for logging purposes only. Lastly, no matter what you do, people right now are offering rewards for voting, with methods like typing ::vote, or clicking a link, and personally I am against such easy workarounds and cheats.

The main incentive would be to help improve private servers, because at the moment people are easily cheating the current reward methods.

How does typing ::vote or clicking a link force a user to actually vote for the server? It can’t.[/quote]It doesn’t, and I didn’t say it did. I said the opposite, because people are ‘working around’ the fact that they can abuse those methods and ruin hosted RSPS’s economies. The number of people capable of fixing it (with MySQL or whatever) is very small, but if you prefer I could release a tutorial on how to limit rewards to once per hour (or whatever the vote time limit is) I just thought a return-to feature would be a good thing to have.
